column4: I installed a new kernel version and is broken for my computer; it seems the old kernel version is still on my computer. How do I remove the new kernel version and hold the new one?

boot using an older kernel and edit /etc/default/grub and change the default boot and then in a terminal sudo update-grub, next kernel update ittl reset and try to use the new update effectivly skipping a kernel
The thing is that I don't want it to update at all. The support for my hardware is sketchy and doesn't work in the new version
it may be fixed in the next kernel release.... if not reapply and wait (cross finger) for the next kernel release
